other_tests.findings: Increased frequency of habitual seizures with posterior rhythmic slowing evolving into regional spiking and a new seizure type characterized by thrashing and kicking of all limbs.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The new seizure type ceased after VNS was switched off, and the patient's habitual seizures settled down to the preimplantation baseline.

other_tests.findings: SPS were associated with fast rhythms over both occipital areas, and CPS were accompanied by rhythmic slow activity mainly over the posterior quadrants with left-sided emphasis.
Four months post-implantation, seizure frequency of CPS reduced by 40%, and recovery was quicker.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Worsening of epilepsy occurred after increasing the current to 2.5 mA, leading to daily CPS and visual auras, which then subsided after VNS was turned off.
